document.masterDocTitle: Taxonomic notes on Australian species of Sciacharis (Magellanoconnus) (Coleoptera: Staphylinidae: Scydmaeninae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Taxonomic notes on Australian species of Sciacharis (Magellanoconnus) (Coleoptera: Staphylinidae: Scydmaeninae)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Sciacharis ( Magellanoconnus ) carinifrons (Franz)
; implied new combination resulted from placing
Neuraphoconnus Franz
as a junior synonym of
Magellanoconnus Franz
, a subgenus of
Sciacharis Broun.

Magellanoconnus carinifrons (Franz)
; implied new status resulted from elevating
Magellanoconnus
to genus by
Kuschel ( 1990 )
, retained as subgenus by
Franz ( 1993 )
.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Neuraphoconnus kangarouanus
Franz, 1975
: 141
, fig. 117 ; syn. n.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Sciacharis ( Magellanoconnus ) kangarouana (Franz)
; implied new combination resulted from placing
Neuraphoconnus Franz
as a junior synonym of
Magellanoconnus Franz
, a subgenus of
Sciacharis Broun.

Magellanoconnus kangarouanus (Franz)
; implied new status resulted from elevating
Magellanoconnus
to genus by
Kuschel ( 1990 )
, retained as subgenus by
Franz ( 1993 )
.

Type material. Holotype : AUSTRALIA :
♂, six labels (
Fig. 3
): "Port Lincoln / Blackburn" [white, printed], " Neuraphoconnus " [white, handwritten], " Neuraphoconnus / carinifrons / m. / det. H. Franz" [white, handwritten and printed], " Typus " [red, handwritten], " SAMA Database / No. 25 -037016" [white, printed], "
SCIACHARIS
/
( MAGELLANOCONNUS )
/
carinifrons (
Franz, 1975
)
/ det. P. Jałoszyński, ' 14 " [white, printed] ( SAM ).

Additional material studied: holotype of
Neuraphoconnus kangarouanus
, ♂, five labels (
Fig. 4
): "Kangaroo Is. / J. G. O . Tepper" [greenish, printed], " Neuraphoconnus / kangarouanus / m. / det. H. Franz" [white, handwritten and printed], " Typus " [red, handwritten], " SAMA Database / No. 25 -037019" [white, printed], "
SCIACHARIS
/ (
MAGELLANOCONNUS
) /
carinifrons (
Franz, 1975
)
/ det. P. Jałoszyński, ' 14 " [white, printed] ( SAM ).

Revised diagnosis. This is the only Australian species of
Magellanoconnus
and can be identified on the basis of the V-shaped carina on the dorsum of head; the median longitudinal carina on the pronotum and structures of the aedeagus.

Head (
Figs. 1 –2
,
5– 6
) broadest at eyes, HL 0.33 mm , HW 0.35–0.36 mm ; divided by distinct constriction into large and nearly pentagonal anterior part and posterior 'neck region' retracted into prothorax. 'Neck region' broader than half width of vertex. Vertex (
Fig. 5
; vt ) and frons (
Fig. 5
; fr ) confluent and weakly convex, with a pair of narrow carinae extending from posteromesal margin of each supraantennal tubercle posteromesally and connecting just in front of posterior margin of vertex; tempora longer than eyes, distinctly but not strongly convergent posteriorly and near posterior third rapidly bent mesally at an obtuse angle; posterior margin of vertex with barely noticeable median expansion. Frontoclypeal groove absent. Eyes (
Fig. 5
) located in anterior part of head and adjacent to antennal cavities, in lateral view bean-shaped, moderately large, distinctly protruding from head silhouette, moderately finely faceted. Punctures on frons and vertex small, sharply marked, separated by distances comparable to puncture diameters except for posterior portion of area between carinae, which is impunctate; setae on frons and major part of vertex short, sparse and suberect; tempora and posterior margin of vertex with dense thick bristles. Antennae (
Figs. 1–2
) slender, gradually thickening distally, AnL 0.90 mm , all antennomeres elongate.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 1–4. Morphology (1–2) and original set of labels (3–4) of the holotype of
Sciacharis carinifrons (Franz)
(1, 3) and
Sciacharis kangarouana
(Franz)
(2, 4).

FIGURES 5–6. Morphology of
Sciacharis carinifrons
(Franz)
. Head in dorsal (5) and ventral (6) views. Abbreviations: bst, basistipes; cd, cardo; cl, clypeus; fo, foramen occipitale; fr, frons; gal, galea; gp, gular plate; gs, gular suture; hr, hypostomal ridge; lac, lacinia; lp, labial palpus; md, mandible; mn, mentum; mst, mediostipes; mxp, maxillary palpus; occ, occipital constriction; ocp, occiput; ppf, palpifer; ptp, posterior tentorial pit; smn, submentum; stb, supraantennal tubercle; vt, vertex.

FIGURES 7–8. Morphology of
Sciacharis carinifrons
(Franz)
. Prothorax in dorsal (7) and ventral (8) views. Abbreviations: abi, antebasal impression; abp, antebasal pit; bst, basisternal part of prosternum; hy, hypomeron; hyr, hypomeral ridge; lc, lateral carina; lp, lateral pit; mc, median carina; nss, pronotosternal suture; pcc, procoxal cavity; pcs, procoxal socket; pff, profurcal fovea; slc, sublateral carina.

FIGURES 9–11. Morphology of
Sciacharis carinifrons (Franz)
. Pterothorax in ventral view (setae on metaventrite largely omitted) (9); mesoventrite in ventral view (setae omitted) (10); left coxa, femur and tibia in posterior view (11). Abbreviations: aest2, mesanepisternum; aest3, metanepisternum; ar, anterior ridge; dlf, dorsolateral fovea; epm3, metepimeron; lmfa, lateral metafurcal arm; mcp, mesocoxal projection; mscc, mesocoxal cavity; mscs, mesocoxal socket; msff, mesofurcal fovea; msvp, mesoventral process; mtvp, metaventral process; pcr, procoxal rest; v3, metaventrite; vlf, ventrolateral fovea.

FIGURES 12–15. Aedeagus of holotypes of
Sciacharis carinifrons
(Franz)
(12–13) and
Sciacharis kangarouana
(Franz)
(14–15) in ventral (12, 14) and lateral (13, 15) views.

FIGURES 16–19. Aedeagus of holotypes of
Sciacharis carinifrons
(Franz)
(16–17) and
Sciacharis kangarouana
(Franz)
(18–19) in ventral (16, 18) and lateral (17, 19) views.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Legs (
Figs. 1 –2
, 11 ) moderately long and slender; protrochanters (
Fig. 11
) with angulate medioventral expansion; protibiae (
Fig. 11
) with short apical portion strongly bent inwards.
Female. Not studied.

Remarks. The holotypes of
Neuraphoconnus carinifrons
and
N. kangarouanus
were collected in South Australia ; a single known paratype of
N. carinifrons
(not studied) was reported to come from Victoria, without precise locality (
Franz 1975
).

Franz ( 1975 )
distinguished
Neuraphoconnus carinifrons
and
N. kangarouanus
on the basis of respectively presence and absence of V-shaped carinae on the head, different length of antennae and structure of the aedeagus. Both holotypes were covered with greasy dirt and mounted in such a way that comparisons were not possible. After relaxing and remounting it turned out that the carinae on the head are present in both specimens and measurements revealed no difference in the length of antennae. Proportions and shapes of all body parts, distribution of punctures, setae and bristles were found nearly identical in both specimens. The aedeagi, illustrated by
Franz ( 1975 )
as clearly different, in fact are very similar. The source of differences observed by Franz is a different condition of the distal ostium, closed in the holotype of
N. carinifrons
, and open in
N. kangarouanus
. This caused the ventral apical portion of the median lobe to be largely hidden in ventral view in the former specimen, while it is largely exposed in the latter. The structure and arrangement of a complex and asymmetrical internal armature in both specimens is nearly identical, with differences clearly resulting from the closed and open ostium. Therefore, the names
N. carinifrons
and
N. kangarouanus
are here treated as synonyms, and the precedence is given to
N. carinifrons
.
